MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetIconified (Android.Views.View searchView, bool iconify);
.method public static hidebysig void SetIconified(class Android.Views.View searchView, bool iconify) cil managed

Docs.param: a true value will collapse the SearchView to an icon, while a false will expand it.
Docs.summary: Iconifies or expands the SearchView.

remarks.para: Iconifies or expands the SearchView. Any query text is cleared when iconified. This is a temporary state and does not override the default iconified state set by setIconifiedByDefault(boolean). If the default state is iconified, then a false here will only be valid until the user closes the field. And if the default state is expanded, then a true here will only clear the text field and not close it.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetQueryRefinementEnabled (Android.Views.View searchView, bool enable);
.method public static hidebysig void SetQueryRefinementEnabled(class Android.Views.View searchView, bool enable) cil managed

Docs.param: true if all items should have a query refinement button, false if only those items that have a query refinement flag set should have the button.
Docs.summary: Specifies if a query refinement button should be displayed alongside each suggestion or if it should depend on the flags set in the individual items retrieved from the suggestions provider.

remarks.para: Specifies if a query refinement button should be displayed alongside each suggestion or if it should depend on the flags set in the individual items retrieved from the suggestions provider. Clicking on the query refinement button will replace the text in the query text field with the text from the suggestion. This flag only takes effect if a SearchableInfo has been specified with and not when using a custom adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetSearchableInfo (Android.Views.View searchView, Android.Content.ComponentName searchableComponent);
.method public static hidebysig void SetSearchableInfo(class Android.Views.View searchView, class Android.Content.ComponentName searchableComponent) cil managed

Docs.param: The application component whose should be loaded and applied to the SearchView.
Docs.summary: Sets the SearchableInfo for this SearchView.

remarks.para: Sets the SearchableInfo for this SearchView. Properties in the SearchableInfo are used to display labels, hints, suggestions, create intents for launching search results screens and controlling other affordances such as a voice button.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetSubmitButtonEnabled (Android.Views.View searchView, bool enabled);
.method public static hidebysig void SetSubmitButtonEnabled(class Android.Views.View searchView, bool enabled) cil managed

Docs.param: true to show a submit button for submitting queries, false if a submit button is not required.
Docs.summary: Enables showing a submit button when the query is non-empty.

remarks.para: Enables showing a submit button when the query is non-empty. In cases where the SearchView is being used to filter the contents of the current activity and doesn't launch a separate results activity, then the submit button should be disabled.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
